column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////The quality of the ingredients cannot be disparaged
column2: the taste and the texture satisfies as well. I did notice a bit of water around the edge of the crust and the toppings
column3: like it hadn't quite set yet. It actually did get better as it sat for 10 minutes or so. Good stuff. I actually preferred the "lou"
column4: even after hearing about and tasting the much heralded sausage in the delux (mind you
column5: it was good). I think it was the slight bit of cheddar they use in the lou that gives it a bit of zing. normally I have no interest in cheddar on a pizza
